content:
TITLE: Making API Requests to Custom Backend
DESCRIPTION: TypeScript code snippet demonstrating how to make a fetch request to a custom route on the backend server using the BACKEND_HOST global constant.
SOURCE: https://github.com/canva-sdks/canva-apps-sdk-starter-kit/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-12_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
const response = await fetch(`${BACKEND_HOST}/custom-route`);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initiating Drag and Drop in Canva UI
DESCRIPTION: Example of using the new ui.startDrag method to implement drag and drop behavior in the Canva UI.
SOURCE: https://github.com/canva-sdks/canva-apps-sdk-starter-kit/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-12_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
ui.startDrag
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding a Page with Pre-populated Elements in Canva SDK
DESCRIPTION: Example of using the new design.addPage method to add a page with pre-populated elements to a Canva design.
SOURCE: https://github.com/canva-sdks/canva-apps-sdk-starter-kit/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-12_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
design.addPage
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Accessing Design Default Page Dimensions in Canva SDK
DESCRIPTION: Example of using the new design.getDefaultPageDimensions method to retrieve the default dimensions of a new page in the design.
SOURCE: https://github.com/canva-sdks/canva-apps-sdk-starter-kit/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-12_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
design.getDefaultPageDimensions
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Environment Configuration for Backend Integration
DESCRIPTION: Example of the .env file configuration needed to run examples with backend integration, including app ID, origin, and port settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/canva-sdks/canva-apps-sdk-starter-kit/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-12_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
CANVA_APP_ID=AABBccddeeff
CANVA_APP_ORIGIN=#
CANVA_BACKEND_PORT=3001
CANVA_FRONTEND_PORT=8080
CANVA_BACKEND_HOST=http://localhost:3001
CANVA_HMR_ENABLED=FALSE
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Demonstrating Recommended Localization Pattern in React JSX
DESCRIPTION: Example showing the recommended way to use localized messages with react-intl in JSX, particularly for App UI Kit props like ariaLabel.
SOURCE: https://github.com/canva-sdks/canva-apps-sdk-starter-kit/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-12_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: jsx
CODE:
```
// ❌ Not recommended, messages will not be localized.
<Button ariaLabel="Click me">..</Button>
//      ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
// error: Cannot have untranslated text in JSX eslintformatjs/no-literal-string-in-jsx


// ✅ Recommended, messages will be localized.
const intl = useIntl();
<Button .. ariaLabel={intl.formatMessage({..})} >..</Button>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Authentication Configuration - TypeScript
DESCRIPTION: TypeScript code snippet showing the authentication state configuration in the app
SOURCE: https://github.com/canva-sdks/canva-apps-sdk-starter-kit/blob/main/examples/digital_asset_management/README.md#2025-04-12_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
// Comment this next line out for production apps
setAuthState("authenticated");
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cloning and Installing the Canva Apps SDK Starter Kit
DESCRIPTION: Basic commands to clone the Canva Apps SDK starter kit repository from GitHub and install its dependencies using npm.
SOURCE: https://github.com/canva-sdks/canva-apps-sdk-starter-kit/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-12_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git clone git@github.com:canva-sdks/canva-apps-sdk-starter-kit.git
cd canva-apps-sdk-starter-kit
npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting the Local Development Server
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the local development server for the Canva app boilerplate, which makes the app available at http://localhost:8080.
SOURCE: https://github.com/canva-sdks/canva-apps-sdk-starter-kit/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-12_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running an Example App with HTTPS Enabled
DESCRIPTION: Commands to start the development server with HTTPS enabled, which is necessary for previewing apps in Safari browser due to mixed-content security restrictions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/canva-sdks/canva-apps-sdk-starter-kit/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-12_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Run the main app
npm start --use-https

# Run an example
npm start <example-name> --use-https
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing and Running Example Apps
DESCRIPTION: Commands to view the list of available example apps in the starter kit and to run a specific example by name.
SOURCE: https://github.com/canva-sdks/canva-apps-sdk-starter-kit/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-12_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm start examples
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running a Specific Example App
DESCRIPTION: Command syntax for starting a specific example app from the starter kit collection.
SOURCE: https://github.com/canva-sdks/canva-apps-sdk-starter-kit/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-12_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm start <example-name>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Accessing Data Provider SDK in Canva Preview
DESCRIPTION: Updated import path for the Data Provider SDK in the Canva Preview package.
SOURCE: https://github.com/canva-sdks/canva-apps-sdk-starter-kit/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-12_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
@canva/preview/data
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating CSS Module Import Syntax in Canva Apps SDK
DESCRIPTION: Example of the required change in CSS module import syntax due to the upgrade of css-loader to version 7.1.2.
SOURCE: https://github.com/canva-sdks/canva-apps-sdk-starter-kit/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-12_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: diff
CODE:
```
-  import style from "./style.css";
+  import * as style from "./style.css";
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Authentication Example in Canva SDK
DESCRIPTION: Command to run the authentication example from the root directory of the Canva Apps SDK starter kit.
SOURCE: https://github.com/canva-sdks/canva-apps-sdk-starter-kit/blob/main/examples/authentication/README.md#2025-04-12_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
npm start authentication
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Development Server with Ngrok - Bash Command
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the development servers with ngrok integration for public access
SOURCE: https://github.com/canva-sdks/canva-apps-sdk-starter-kit/blob/main/examples/digital_asset_management/README.md#2025-04-12_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm start digital_asset_management --ngrok
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Development Server - Bash Command
DESCRIPTION: Command to launch the frontend and backend development servers for digital asset management
SOURCE: https://github.com/canva-sdks/canva-apps-sdk-starter-kit/blob/main/examples/digital_asset_management/README.md#2025-04-12_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm start digital_asset_management
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Navigating to Starter Kit Directory - Bash Command
DESCRIPTION: Command to change directory to the Canva Apps SDK starter kit location
SOURCE: https://github.com/canva-sdks/canva-apps-sdk-starter-kit/blob/main/examples/digital_asset_management/README.md#2025-04-12_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cd canva-apps-sdk-starter-kit
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Preview SDK from NPM
DESCRIPTION: A bash command demonstrating how to install a preview version of the @canva/design SDK using the @beta tag.
SOURCE: https://github.com/canva-sdks/canva-apps-sdk-starter-kit/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-12_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install @canva/design@beta
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Deprecated Components Table
DESCRIPTION: Markdown table showing deprecated components in the /components/ directory and their new replacements from app-ui-kit.
SOURCE: https://github.com/canva-sdks/canva-apps-sdk-starter-kit/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-12_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| Deprecated Component   | New Component          |
| ---------------------- | ---------------------- |
| `DraggableVideo`       | `VideoCard`            |
| `DraggableText`        | `TypographyCard`       |
| `DraggableImage`       | `ImageCard`            |
| `DraggableEmbed`       | `EmbedCard`            |
| `DraggableAudio`       | `AudioCard`            |
| `AudioContextProvider` | `AudioContextProvider` |
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Ngrok Authentication Token - Unix/Linux
DESCRIPTION: Command to set the NGROK_AUTHTOKEN environment variable in macOS and Linux systems
SOURCE: https://github.com/canva-sdks/canva-apps-sdk-starter-kit/blob/main/examples/digital_asset_management/README.md#2025-04-12_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
export NGROK_AUTHTOKEN=<YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Ngrok Authentication Token - Windows PowerShell
DESCRIPTION: Command to set the NGROK_AUTHTOKEN environment variable in Windows PowerShell
SOURCE: https://github.com/canva-sdks/canva-apps-sdk-starter-kit/blob/main/examples/digital_asset_management/README.md#2025-04-12_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
$Env:NGROK_AUTHTOKEN = "<YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN>"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Changelog Entries Documentation
DESCRIPTION: Structured changelog following Keep a Changelog format, documenting changes to the Canva Apps SDK Starter Kit including API updates, example code changes, and dependency version upgrades.
SOURCE: https://github.com/canva-sdks/canva-apps-sdk-starter-kit/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-12_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
### 🔧 Changed

- `examples`
  - Remove `dataUrl` usages in all examples. We recommend [Upload API](https://www.canva.dev/docs/apps/api/asset-upload/#uploading-images) before adding images to the design.
  - Updated [/examples/image_editing_overlay](/examples/image_editing_overlay) to use `@canva/design` and `@canva/platform` instead of `@canva/preview`.
- `utils/backend`
  - Fixed a number of minor linting and typing related warnings.
- `examples/digital_asset_management`
  - Updated `@canva/app-components` to version `1.0.0-beta.17` in `digital_asset_management` example.
- `README.md`
  - Minor ordering changes of content in the repository [README.md](/README.md).
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Upgrading Node Version via NVM
DESCRIPTION: Command to upgrade Node.js to the LTS version v20.10.0 using Node Version Manager (nvm) at the repository root.
SOURCE: https://github.com/canva-sdks/canva-apps-sdk-starter-kit/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-12_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
nvm install
```

----------------------------------------
